DOC.brief_summary: This study aim test hypothesis jailed-balloon technique ( JBT ) superior jailed-wire technique ( JWT ) non-left main coronary bifurcation percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) lower risk side branch ( SB ) loss PCI relate myocardial infarction , well 1-year major adverse cardiovascular event ( MACEs ) .
DOC.brief_title: Jailed-balloon Technique Coronary Bifurcation Lesion PCI
DOC.detailed_description: 1 . Objective : To compare protective effect JBT JWT PCI non-left main coronary bifurcation lesion . 2 . Background : Solid evidence scant compare protective effect JBT JWT PCI non-left main coronary bifurcation lesion . 3 . Study design : This multi-center , prospective , randomize study . 4 . Methods 4a . Study population : Patients non-left main coronary bifurcation lesion ( Medina 1,1,1 ) , SBs less 2.5mm 1mm , enrol study . Patients randomized JBT group JWT group . 4b . Procedure : For patient enrolled JBT group , monorail balloon place ostium SB protect SB stent main branch ( MB ) deploy . Only PTCA wire would place SB stenting MB patient randomize JWT group . Only drug-eluting stent implant target vessel .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age ≥18 year ≤75 year ; 2 . De novo Medina 1,1,1 coronary bifurcation main branch ( MB ) > 2.5mm side branch < 2.5mm > 1.5mm ; 3 . Only one bifurcation lesion need treat one vessel ; 4 . The target lesion MB stenosis 75 % fractional flow reserve ( FFR ) less 0.75 stenosis SB ostium 50 % ; 5 . Signed consent obtain . 1 . Left ventricular ejection fraction ( LVEF ) less 30 % ; 2 . Hemodynamic instability cardiac shock ; 3 . Myopathy muscular injury elevation creatine kinase 3mg/dL ; 4 . Tumor expect survival less 1 year ; 5 . Autoimmune disease ; 6 . Active gastrointestinal bleeding contraindication dual antiplatelet therapy ; 7 . Acute coronary syndrome require emergency PCI ; 8 . Coronary bifurcation need treat twostent strategy ; 9 . Not suitable drugeluting stent ( DES ) implantation ; 10 . Mental disorder alcohol dependence ; 11 . PCI coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) within 6 month enrollment ; 12 . Target lesion instent restenosis ; 13 . Women gestation period lactation period human chorionic gonadotropin ( HCG ) urine test positive .
